alert.note: Alert for City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 8:23PM EDT until July 03 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following independent cities, City of Chesapeake, City of Norfolk, City of Portsmouth and City of Virginia Beach. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 821 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen since this afternoon. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Virginia Beach, Kempsville, Regent University, Great Bridge, Virginia Wesleyan University, Norfolk State University, Downtown Norfolk, Downtown Portsmouth, Deep Creek, Old Dominion University, Churchland, Norfolk, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Fentress, Princess Anne, Norfolk International, Back Bay and Norview. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: City of Chesapeake; City of Norfolk; City of Portsmouth; City of Virginia Beach
